file_content.text: Hey, I heard you took care of that ambush. You can tell your bosses where to find me, y'know, if they want to send a reward or something.
I already told you, the bombs are hidden alongside the road near here. That's all I know--I swear!
Oh no, not this again! What, you people didn't have enough fun beating me up at the fort, you gotta come find me here, too?
You're nothing but thugs in uniform, and your bosses are going to hear about it--your bosses' bosses, all the way on Coruscant, you hear me? You're going down!
You have every right to be mad, sir--but I really need your assistance.
I'm sorry for what happened.
This was all just a misunderstanding, sir. Calm down.
Take it easy.
Look, what do you want from me? Huh? Because I've had enough of you people for a lifetime.
I'm not just a thug in a uniform--I'm a heavily armed thug in a uniform.
You'd better watch yourself.
Yeah, I see that. So do you want something, or are you just here to threaten me?
You said you had information for us earlier. I came to find out what you know.
Tell me about the bombing.
Don't play coy.
Where have the separatists hidden the device? When are they gonna detonate it?
The bomb--now!
So now you want the information. Well, y'know, I probably could've helped a few hours ago, before that whole savage beating I got.
But now, after all the trauma, I might have just forgot everything I knew about any separatist bombings.
Please--thousands of lives are at stake here!
Your information is vital!
What about my life, huh? Things ain't that easy out here for me.
I don't have time for games.
Pushy, pushy, pushy. You grunts just have no respect at all--that's the problem.
I'll bet you'd remember everything if I just hit you hard enough.
Don't make me hurt you.
See, now, that's exactly the kind of attitude that got you people into this mess. You need to make me feel appreciated!
Now, if I knew how much the Republic valued my contributions, say with a few credits--my memory would probably be much better.
There. Now tell me what you know about this bombing.
Fine, take some of my money.
Now you're talking. All right, here's what's going down.
I'll speak to my superiors about your compensation after we've acted on your intelligence.
We'll arrange a reward later.
The same superiors who threw me out of the fort? I don't buy that for a minute.
The situation is different now--getting your intel is priority one.
Things have changed.
Trust me, I have a lot of pull up at the fort. You'll get your due.
I promise you'll be rewarded.
Fine, fine, whatever. Just remember who it is that helped you out on this, all right?
Failure to aid a Republic agent is treason, Mirru. And I don't like traitors.
You're dead if you don't help.
How about I just start shooting off your fingers, Mirru? That sounds fun.
I'm done talking.
Whoa! Whoa! Hey, let's just calm down a minute here! Okay, I'll help.
I saw the separatists hiding a bunch of bombs alongside the road near here. You know, setting up an ambush.
I heard them say the bombs are timed to blow when some troop convoy is going past. I don't know when, but it's gotta be soon.
I have to save those troops! They'll be killed!
I can't let that happen!
Yeah, if your people felt like that earlier, I could've saved myself the beat-down.
You just happened to see this?
Word went around the camp not to be on that road anytime soon, so my buddy and me went to take a look. We saw 'em setting everything up.
Our people tend to get caught in the cross fire. It's in our interest to stay on top of things.
I don't care about some random ambush. The bomb I'm after is big--really big.
That isn't the intel I wanted.
Well, that's the only tip I've got for you. You're lucky I'm giving you anything at all, way I've been treated.
So, are we done here? 'Cause I got a lot of work I need to do around the camp today.
Thank you for your cooperation, sir. It's greatly appreciated.
Yes, that's all I needed.
Uh, yeah, sure. Anytime.
Keep your eyes open--we need all the intel we can get.
Let us know if you learn more.
Oh yeah, sure. I'll stay in touch.
If you're lying, you'll pay.
Go see for yourself.
Soldiers don't carry a lot of credits around with them.
I don't have any money on me.
Well then, I guess my memory's gonna be staying cloudy, isn't it?
Do you really want to be responsible for the deaths this bombing will cause?
Then innocent people will die.
Hey, how's it going?
